com.uct.cs.wsintelliauction.db.orm

Class DatabaseManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uct.cs.wsintelliauction.db.orm.DatabaseManager

  • public class DatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages all object-relational database configuration and transactions, using the Hibernate library, with annotations. Configuration settings for this manager are specified by the 'hibernate_config' property in the application property file. The manager implements all basic database query functions, however the DatabaseManager.query() method allows for execution of HQL queries, providing greater control than the convenience methods.
    Note
    All persistent classes must be annotated with the javax.persistence library annotations. All persistent classes must also be specified in the hibernate configuration XML file as an element.
    Author:
    James Lewis

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseManager

        public DatabaseManager()
        Constructs a new Object-Relational database layer manager. The session factory for this instance is configured from the configuration file as specified by CONFIG_FILE

    • Method Detail

      • saveOrUpdate

        public void saveOrUpdate(java.lang.Object tuple)
        If the tuple doesn't exist in the tuplet's table, it is appended to the table. If the tuple already exists, the tuple is is updated. If the table doesn't exist for the tuple's schema, the schema is exported to the database and the tuple is appended.
        Parameters:
        tuplet - Object to save or update

      • query

        public <E> java.util.ArrayList<E> query(java.lang.String stm)
        Executes a database query statement and returns the result as a list of objects.
        Note: The query language is in HQL, not SQL.
        The HQL language is very similar to SQL, with a few differences. Example, to query James from Team in HQL:
        FROM Team WHERE Name='James'
        HQL is almost identical to SQL. A quick tutorial which describes how to use it:
        HQL Tutorial
        Parameters:
        stm - Statement to execute
        Returns:
        Result set

      • deleteObject

        public void deleteObject(java.lang.Object tuple)
        Removes the specified object from the database. The object in the database is removed if it matches the CLASS of the specified tuple as well as the ID.
        Parameters:
        tuple - Object to remove.

      • getTable

        public <E> java.util.ArrayList<E> getTable(java.lang.Class<E> schema)
        Returns an entire table as identified by the specified class (schema). The parameter must be specified as: ObjectClassName.class.
        Parameters:
        schema - Class type.
        Returns:
        List of all tuples in the table, or null if table doesn't exist.

      • containsID

        public <E> boolean containsID(java.lang.Class<E> schema,
                     java.lang.Long id)
        Checks if an object specified by the class and id exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        schema - Class type (use ObjectClassName.class)
        id - The primary key value of the object.
        Returns:
        True if exists, false otherwise.

      • loadByID

        public <E> E loadByID(java.lang.Class<E> schema,
             java.lang.Long id)
        Loads and returns an object which matches the specified class and identifier.
        Parameters:
        schema - Class type (use ObjectClassName.class)
        id - Object identifier (primary key)
        Returns:
        Object from the database which matches the above criteria.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the session factory. Should always be called when the factory is no longer in use.
